name: Succession Certificate
shortDescription: A succession certificate, under the Indian Succession Act, is a document that gives authority to the person who obtains it, to represent the deceased for the purpose of collecting debts and securities due to him or payable in his name.

content.title: Time of death of the deceased
content.description: The certificate shall include the details of the deceased along with time and place of death.

content.title: Address of the deceased
content.description: The certificate shall provide the full address of the residence of deceased or any other place the deceased was residing before his death.

content.title: Property details
content.description: The details of the property are written in the certificate. the details include plot area, identification number, details of construction, the exact location and surroundings of the property.

content.title: Details of family members
content.description: The certificate shall provide the names, age, and full address of the family members of the deceased. It also details the relationship between the deceased and family members.

content.title: Rights of the petitioner
content.description:
The certificate outlines the rights of the petitioner. It includes the proof of what right or what capacity he should be nominated as the successor of the departed. Sufficient evidence that the said asset does not fall under the restrictive cases and
there is no dispute to his claim as a successor.

content.title: Details of debts and securities
content.description: The certificate also includes the details of the debts and securities attached to the property.
a succession certificate is the primary document through which the heirs can stake a claim to the assets of a deceased relative
It establishes the legitimacy of the heirs and gives them the authority to get the deposits and other assets transferred in their names.

faqs.question: Who grants the Succession Certificate?
faqs.answer: The District Judge grants a succession certificate, The Judge grants a certificate specifying the debts and securities set forth in the application empowering the person to receive interest or dividend or to negotiate or transfer or do both.

faqs.question: What is the importance of a succession certificate?
faqs.answer:
The succession certificate affirms who the legal heirs of the deceased are and that
there was no will. This may be enough for the legal heirs to administer and dispose of
property.

faqs.question: I have a succession certificate; how can I get it reviewed by a Lawyer?
